intro: Uvariodendron dzomboense, commonly known as the Zambian mahogany, is a small to medium-sized tree native to the eastern part of the Democratic Republic of the Congo. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant produces small, round fruits that contain a single seed, which is encased in a hard, woody shell. It is often found in moist, lowland forests and is valued for its durable, aromatic wood.
